messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 75
messages.msgSnippet: This is such an important thing to learn though! Maybe a few wasted toys and less-than-great paper towels are worth learning this. We have great fun at the
messages.messageBody:
This is such an important thing to learn though!

Maybe a few wasted toys and less-than-great paper towels are worth learning
this.

We have great fun at the TV's expense -- and advertisers and politicians and
newscasters and . . . well, just about anybody who is trying to spin or hustle
. . .

My kids are older -- 9 and 11 -- but this critical analysis (cynisism? :) )
of marketing techniques is a terrific way to develop logical thinking and all
sorts of real life valuable skills.

My 2 cents anyway. :)

Nance

In a message dated 7/6/2004 5:23:26 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:
Although, I have to admit that she is beginning to learn about ads being used
to manipulate you into buying their product...saying things that aren't
necessarily true.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
